TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UpdateProgressDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner

Docs.summary: Provides design-time support for the control in a visual designer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class documentation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.UpdatePanelDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.UpdatePanel> control or a copy of that control on the design surface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml(class System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection regions) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that contains control designer regions for the associated control.
Docs.summary: Returns the HTML markup to display the control and populates the collection with the current control designer regions.
Docs.returns: The design-time HTML markup for the associated control, which includes all control designer regions.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetEditableDesignerRegionContent(class System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to fetch content for.
Docs.summary: Returns the content for an editable region of the design-time view of the control.
Docs.returns: A serialized copy of the template that is used to render the associated control at design time.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void SetEditableDesignerRegionContent (System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region, string content);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void SetEditableDesignerRegionContent(class System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region, string content) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that provides the name of the region to update.
A serialized template for the associated control.
Docs.summary: Specifies the content for the editable region of the control at design time.
Gets a value that indicates whether the designer should use a temporary copy instead of the actual control associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.
